description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to feed all your food to Ralph. On each turn players roll the die and must feed him certain food.  A numbered roll (1, 2, or 3) indicates the number of food that he must swallow. If a player rolls "Stuff", he or she can attempt to feed him as much food as he or she wants to attempt. If he regurgitates the food, the player must keep it which may include some that he or she did not feed him. (Ralph is also a common expression for vomiting.)

Dietary note: "Ralph has a sensitive stomach! Please don't feed him anything except the special cardboard food enclosed."

King of the Hill is a version of the children's game of War, with a strategic aspect added.  Just like the parent game, it uses ordinary playing cards.  Players get to choose the cards to be played and the reward for winning.  A separate reserve of cards to break ties adds to the strategy.  Win as many cards as you can, but remember, only the player who wins the last battle can be King of the Hill!

Bosconian-D is a print-and-play solo dice wargame based on the old Namco arcade game of the same name.

In up to 36 sectors of space destroy your enemy's bases, or encounter various enemies. Destroy them or they will damage your ship.

Can you eliminate all enemy bases before your ship is sustains 100 points of damage?

All you need are the rules, dice and a pencil. Counters for your ship and the enemy bases, a simple grid board, and an encounter die is provided.

Creepy crawly – what's that crawling over there? It's the colorful caterpillars who are scuttling out from under the leaves bit by bit! Whoever is lucky enough with the dice in Caterpillar Dice to make her own complete caterpillar wins!

From the Publishers Website:
uPSet is a thrilling and unpredictable combination of chance and strategy where one throw of the dice or one play of a card can turn the game around and the winner of the game is in doubt until the very last second.
Using dice, cards, an interactive scoresheet and poker-style chips (uPcentS), uPSet takes only a few minutes to learn but every game is a different roller-coaster ride of fun and excitement. uPSet strikes that perfect balance between rewarding skilled and strategic play and introducing the element of luck to make sure that everyone has a chance to win and victory is never a sure thing.

Inspired by games played in Labrador fishing villages, Upset includes specialty dice, cards, chips, and interactive scorecards that shape play by determining who gets the cards and when.  The object of the game is to score points with the dice (10,000 to win) and strategically use the Upset cards to beat your opponent.  Players strategize not only on how and when they play their cards, but also how to get or avoid getting the cards.  However, the special dice contain letters as well as numbers and if someone rolls the word "Upset," then everyone else, no matter how close they are to winning, must restart from scratch.

Home Page: http://www.playupset.com/

The object of this abstract game is to place five tokens of one color in a row in any direction on a special 12 by 12 game board grid or to force your opponent into three "traps" -- the twenty red squares on the game board.

The four-player version of the game involves team play while the three-player version involves one player alternatively playing against the other two.

100 points for completing a five-in-a-row formation.

Other bonus scoring include the following:
     100 points for completing a five-in-a-row formation with 10 tokens or less.
     50 points for completing a five-in-a-row formation within the pink square.
     50 points for forcing your opponent into 3 traps.
     20 points for forcing your opponent into 2 traps.
     10 points for forcing your opponent into 1 trap.

This game was manufactured by Wales Games Systems, Inc., a division of Wales-Strippit Corporation in North Tonawanda, New York, USA.  It was later slightly modified to fit in with the western theme of Wales Game Systems' other games, having a cowboy hat added to the drawing of Joe and becoming "Tagalong Cowboy Joe," a "64-32 Ranch Game."

The object of this vintage abstract game is to make a straight line of four pieces or a diamond shape.  The game comes with a gridded game board, two sets of colored pegs, and some score sheets.  The complete instructions are on the inside of the outer lid.

Played on 7x7. The object is to get a line of four orthogonally, or diagonally. Also a box of four "on and angle" with the center square empty counts as a win.

(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

KUnnskap (KU=cow) på boks is a trivia and strategy game for the whole family! The game consists of general trivia questions, riddles and picture puzzles at two levels: one for mature cows (more or less adults) - and one suited for 10 year olds (playful calves) and up.

Strategy? Well, it is all about getting the largest field. The player with the largest field, wins the game! One has to use strategic cunning by colour mounds. The point is to hinder the other players in expanding their fields, while every player tries to make their own fields as large and bountiful as possible. The players amass points by solving the exercises.

På forhånd bestemmer man seg for å spille med en stor beitemark (+ 1 time) eller en mindre hvis man ønsker et raskere spill (+ 30 minutter). Spillet egner seg for 2 til 4 spillere eller lag.

Illustrasjonene er elleville og humoristiske og vil glede både store og små!

In advance the players decide either to play for a large field (60+ minutes) or a smaller one if they wish a quicker game (30+ minutes). The game is suitable for 2 to 4 players or teams.

The illustrations are hilarious and humouristic, and will please young and old!

Mooohh!

New Gladiators - Retiarius; Amazon; Bestiarius; Criminal; Lion. New rules. A complete Campaign system. Colour-coded dice.

New Stuff. More Stuff.

A complete game in it's own right and also totally compatible with Ludus Gladiatorius 1.

Gladiators supplied painted. Play sheet included. Everything required to play is supplied, including a pouch to randomly pick counters from..!

This is the sequel of Ludus Gladiatorius. Integrates with it, but it's also completely playable stand-alone.

In Donald Ducks Bondegårdspill (Donald Duck's Farm Game), the players play Hewey, Dewey and Louis (and perhaps Phooey ?) on Grandma Duck's farm trying to collect a complete set of apples, milk, corn and egg.

Contents:

- Game board
- Wheel with needle to attach to the board
- Four playing pieces with plastic feet
- 16 pieces of apples, milk, corn and egg
- One special die

In Bursdagsspillet (The Birthday Game), the players are invited to Donald Duck's birthday party and must play a round of the Hat Game before proceeding to the cake.

The players throw the dice to determine which color of the hat to move. A hat can be put on top of one single other hat, be freed on special balloon squares, or being swapped if the special die shows the party hat. When a single or double hat passes the finish line, one point goes to the player playing the color of the hat on the top.

Contents:

- Game board
- 16 hats in 4 colors
- 1 regular die
- 1 special die with colors

In Fischer Price Bondegårdspillet (Fischer Price's The Farm Game), players compete to collect all of their food pieces. Each player controls one animal and simultaneously the farmer and his or her animal. If the farmer is adjacent to the animal (they move in separate zones of the board), the animal is fed.

The first player to get ten food pieces wins.

Contents:

Game board
Farmer figure
Four animal figures
40 food pieces
One colored die

Form & Gjett (Mould and Guess) is a unique game where two and two players team up. Each round, one of the players of the team chooses a timed task (Foot in the air, jump like a rabbit, swing your arms etc) and tries to perform that action as long as possible, while the other player moulds whatever is depicted on the figure card. The first team to fill their sheet wins.

Contents:

Six time sheets with six tasks each
54 figure cards
Two boxes of moulding clay

A children's game which can be played two different ways.  In both games 12 tiles are set in a square and each player places their cow on the first square.  The objective is to get your cow around the square.  The colored milk bottles are set up in the middle of the square.

In the version called The Cow Goes Moo, each player takes turns rolling the color die and trying to knock over up to five bottles, but not more than five or they will lose their turn.  The player gets to move their cow one space for each fallen bottle which matches the color rolled on the die.

In the Big Cow Poker version, before each roll, every player secretly chooses a color card.  The roller knocks down up to five milk bottles and each player gets to move a number of spaces equal to the number of fallen bottles which match their card.

In Witch - Stjernespillet (Witch - The star game), players compete to reach the center of the playing field.

The sign cards tell whether the player should move forwards or backwards, and the number cards is played by the player to say how many squares she or he wants to move.

If a heart square is reached, the player must see if his or her sign of the zodiac matches one on the topmost dream boy card.

Contents:

Game board
38 sign cards
38 number cards
12 sign of the zodiac cards
12 dream boy cards
Four pawns

In Gulljakten (The Goldrush) is a children's game where the players use a scale to measure the amount of gold they dig.

When landing on a green square, the player gains gold, and when landing on a red square, the player must purchase food, drinks or being robbed.

All actions use the scales to weigh the token on the square, and balance them with an appropriate number of lumps of gold on the other side.

Contents:

Game board
Four gold diggers with plastic feet
Four digging tools
One die
Lumps of gold
One pair of scales

Three childrens games can be played with this set of letter stamps, "ghost" tins and "ghost" word cards.

In Little Ghostly Alphabet the objective is to stamp two words.  The stamps are put in the tins.  Then each player gets a ghost card with a word on it.  The words are in multiple languages, including English. Each turn a player selects a tin, then stamps any letters which are in their word.  The letters must be stamped in order.

The Word Searchers is a variation on Hangman, using the stamps.

In G as Ghost, the stamps are again put in the tins.  Each player chooses a tin, then uses a stamp inside to either start a new word or extend a word that is already started.  Players must announce the word they are thinking of.  Other players can either stamp the letters in that word or switch to another word as long as the letters already stamped match the new word.  Only three words can be started at a time.  The game ends after five words are completed.

Junior Geni is a children's edition of the very popular Norwegian trivia game Geni, with simplified rules and different question categories.

The goal of this game is to answer one question correctly from each of the four categories, and then answer questions from two given categories, moving to the center of the board. The first player to reach the center is the winner.

Originally released in 1988, the game has been re-released with new questions and categories in 1995, 1998, 2000, 2003 and 2007.

Each game typically contains 250 cards, all with questions from all four categories, including 'Books and music', 'Our world', 'Nature', 'Entertainment', 'Science', varying from the different editions.

From the front of the box:

"Triolo is a game of skill for two players.  You begin with twelve counters each and take turns to place them around the network of lines on the Triolo board.  Maneuver three of your counters into a straight line and you've formed a Triolo.  Each time you outwit your opponent and form a Triolo you take one of his counters from the board.  Form enough Triolos to remove all his counters and you win the game."

A game for all ages from 8 to 99 years.

Made by LDS (Latter Day Saints) Game Factory in Placerville, CA. I don't have the instructions, but it looks as though players go around the board -- and off into little side trips like Talents, Leisure, Career, Church. Family and Education -- to gather Blessings but to avoid Trespasses. According to the score sheets, you tally each, plus add the number of side trips made to the Blessing column and it looks like the highest Blessing score wins.

Knowledge cards get you Blessings or Trespasses. Free Agency cards quote verses from LDS scripture. Corner spaces are significant: Go on a Mission or to the Tree of Life; these are the good squares. The bad ones are Temptation and Sin City. It looks like Sin City is like Monopoly's Jail square. You must roll to get out and the longer it takes, the more Trespasses you get.

Hjulene på bussen (The Wheels on the Bus) is a children's game where the players try and get all their pawns on the bus that goes around the game board.

Each turn, the player first throw the die and moves the bus. If the bus gets to a bus stop with pawns on, it stops and the pawns are entering the bus (removed from the game). Then the player throws the die once more and moves one of his or her pawns.

The first player to get all pawns on the bus, wins.

Contents:

16 pawns in four colors
One bus pawn with plastic foot
One die

Hopp med Pippi (Jump along with Pippi) as a children's game in the theme of Astrid Lindgren's Pippi Longstocking.

The players play Don't touch the floor in Pippi's mansion Villa Villekulla.

Each turn, the players throw the dice with arrows (straight ahead, turn left and turn right), and try to match them with the arrows on the oncoming squares. Then the player throws the special die, and if Pippi is shown, then he or she can move a Pippi token to cover a hole in the floor. If the players fall in a hole, they miss a turn.

Contents:

Game board
One Pippi die
Four dice with arrows
Two Pippi tokens
Four pawns

Juliaspillet - bare for jenter (not to be confused with Juliaspillet (2005) by the same publisher, is a game, where the players must find out who is their secret admirer.

Before starting, each player gets a boy card which they cannot look at. By completing various tasks, the player gets to see one of the other boy cards, and in the end collect enough information to correctly guess the secret admirer. If a player guesses incorrectly, she (or he) loses.

Contents:

Game board
Four pawns
One die
10 boy cards
45 task cards
One result pad

In Herkules - Heltespillet (Hercules - The Game of Heroes), players try to collect 10 swords and return to the starting square.

Each turn, the player moves both his or her own pawn and the Hades pawn (in any direction). If landing on a hero square, the hero token there is turned over, and the player can lose or gain swords. If Hades reaches a player, they lose half their swords.

Contents:

Game board
Four Hercules pawns with plastic feet
Two dice
38 sword tokens
20 hero tokens
Four Magara pawns
One Hades pawn

The Game of Roodles consists of fifty-six cards composed of four series, Wishbone, Horseshoe, Shamrock and Swasticka, each series being number from 1 to 14 consecutively.  The object of the game is to get rid of the cards in your hand according to the rules of the game.  Roodles could be classified as belonging to the Rummy family of games.

Another information page states:  The set contains 57 cards comprising 1-14 in each suit of wishbones, horseshoes, shamrocks and swastikas plus a Roodles joker card who juggles all the suit symbols.

(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

Kjendis på boks (Celebrity in a box) is a completely new and hilarious game in the På boks (in a box) series. The game is based on the TV show "Kjendisjakten" (Celebrity hunt), which has been programmed at TV2 since the summer og 2004. The game has been developed in cooperation with the editorial staff of "Kjendisjakten" (RubiconTV).

People in general have great interest for what Hollywood stars, royalty, artists, jet setters and reality wannabes are up to. Therefore you have, together with your family and friends, the chance to hunt for celebrities around the living room table or in the cottage. Each player get to be "presenter" in turn. The object is to guess whom is hiding at the picture behind the pieces. Questions are picked from nine different categories like; movies, sport, culture, power and music.

The game is suitable for teenagers and adults.

The game contains five unique collection boards (each with nine reproduced artworks from the National Gallery's collection) and forty-five picture cards- one match for each image from the collection boards. The backs of each card are identically labeled.  The game is played like memory- but the objective is to be the first person to collect all the images from your own collection board.

Eventyrspill (Fairy Tale Game) is a Disney themed Memory-like game where players must find six different Disney characters. Players move around the playing piece to turn around cards. If Cruella de Ville is turned over, the player must find one Dalmatian before he or she can win.

Contents:

- Game board
- 4 playing pieces
- 56 Disney cards

(From the box)

Create your own unique multi-colour caterpillar and race to victory in this exciting game.

Aim of the game: To be the first player to cross the finish line with your caterpillar.

1. Build your multi-colour 6 segment caterpillar.
2. Set up the finish line and decide the starting point of the race.
3. Take it in turns to roll the dice. Move your caterpillar segments (starting from the back) one in front of the other until the coloured segment at the front matches the colour on the dice. Place the head on the front segment.
4. If the colour on the die matches the colour of the front segment of your caterpillar, you miss a go. If this happens you can place a barrier in front of your opponent to slow them down.
5. Your opponent must now move around the barrier in order to reach the finish line.
6. The winning caterpillar is the one to cross the finish line first.

Shrewd is a fast-paced strategy game where deal-making, manipulation, and a bit of luck lead to success. Players aim to maximize their wealth through savvy arbitrage—buying low and selling high—and by meeting the requirements to win various funds like the Monopoly Fund, Greed Fund, Shrewd Fund, or one of the five Equity Funds. The player with the most money at the end wins.

This engaging game challenges players to outwit their opponents and make the most profitable deals, making every session a test of strategic thinking and negotiation skills.
The Third Reich's desperate Ardennes offensive of Christmas '44: The Battle of the Bulge.

Beneath the Waves (BtW) is a board-game but started as a floor-top game played entirely at shows. The game is set in a fictional world around 1870. Each player commands one or more steam punk submarines with the goal to sink the opposing side's submarines or fulfill a certain goal/mission.

In order to control a submarine usefully you have to order the crew to perform all the different tasks necessary to the running of a submarine. Then you have to decide the movement of the submarine, trying to outsmart your opponents move. While executing the movement you have to fire the weapons at the right moment to insure maximum devastation.

The game is played by two or more players. The players belong to one side or the other, Germany or the Confederate States of America (CSA). Each side has one or more submarines, three or four for a normal game.

Children's game. Contents: 12 plastic carrots in a bag, 1 spinner, game board.

Players twist a little spinner that moves "spinningly" over the gameboard and when it lands in one of the holes that represents carrot holes the player can "dig up" a carrot. If the spinner lands in one of the three mole hills, the player misses his / her next turn. The player that first wins a certain number of carrots (3 in a 3 or 4 player game, 5 in a 2 player game) wins the game. Ages 5 - 12

From the Instruction folder:

"CHECK-O is an exciting new game, designed to entertain every member of the family.  Two, three or four people can play."

"Action takes place on a board with traditional checker-squares on it, separated so that red squares touch red squares at diagonal corners and similarly, white squares touch white squares at diagonal corners.  Moves by players are made diagonally."

"The object of the game is to capture opponents' men by leap-frogging over them until the checkers of only one player remain."

"It will be noted that there is a big square area in the center of the board.  Wings extend in four directions giving the playing area the shape of a cross."

"CHECK-O is a direct descendant of the ancient game of Checkers, devised over 5,000 years ago by the Egyptian Pharoahs (sic), so history tells us."

"When the Roman soldiers conquered Egypt, they took home many souvenirs of their exploits in North Africa.  Among these was the game of Checkers.  Even in ancient times, moves were made in the same way - diagonally across the board - and each player faced his opponent with twelve men."

"CHECK-O, though similar to Checkers, is faster-moving and gives more opportunity for strategy.  This is especially true in CHECK-O DOUBLES when each player must out-plan and out-think three opponents who are coming towards him from three different directions."

This is a fairly basic roll-and-move game, imitating an equestrian (dressage) competition. Players race their horses through a track which has various printed events as well as "Chance" and "What the judge says" spaces, both of which give cards that the players keep for the duration of the game, and which represent events happening during the competition, giving either positive or negative points. Unlike most roll-and-move games, while getting to the Finish first (and second, third etc.) carries a good bonus it does not mean automatic victory; once all the players have reached the Finish line, points gathered from the cards are counted also and the one with highest point total wins the game.

Campus takes players to the university world. Players are trying to get a degree and in order to achieve that goal they'll have to answer correctly. There are questions from 18 different areas of science. Players are moving around the campus trying to gain the needed knowledge. Giving right answers is actually as hard as finding the right questions.

From the back of the box:  Designed by Hindu Sages over two thousand years ago and the precursor to the game "chutes and ladders," Leela is nothing less than the game of life, providing insight into our own consciousness and a key to divine knowledge.  One or more can play the game of Leela, using only the book and game board, a die, and a significant object that belongs to the player (such as a ring) to serve as his or her symbol during the game...

Junior True or False is as the name suggests a children's edition of True or False, and has the following categories: "Nature and Animals", "Said and done", "Long time ago" and "Mixed".

Also includes the special die that gives bonus if the die has correct.

Contents:

Game Board
185 question cards
12 true or false cards
Two topic cards
Six pawns
One special die

Jul i Skomakergata (Christmas at Shoemaker Street) is a spin-off from the most popular advent calendar children's show in Norway.

The players must match all shoe pairs with the correct owner, and at the same time make sure they can feed Tøfflus parsley whenever he appears.

Contents:

Game board
24 shelf cards
18 parsley cards
Four pawns with plastic feet
Four markers
One spinner

(copied from instruction sheet:)Jeder Spieler erhält 2 Figuren einer Farbe. Aufgabe ist es, als erster beide Figuren in das Ziel zu bringen. Der jüngste Spieler beginnt. Man rückt so viele Felder vor, wie man Augen gewürfelt hat. Rückwärts ziehen ist nicht erlaubt. Wer eine 6 wirft, darf nochmals würfeln.

Auf jedem Spielfeld darf nur eine Figur stehen. Rauswerfen ist erlaubt. Wer auf ein Feld mit orangefarbener Zahl kommt, hat die entsprechende Anweisung ohne Widerstand zu befolgen. Beide Spielfiguren müssen mit direktem Wurf ins Ziel gebracht werden. Wem dies gelingt ist Sieger.

(English translation from on-line translator and re-worded a bit by me:)Each player receives two pawns of the same color. The challenge is to bring both pawns to the end space. I presume this to be the giant electrical plug at the end of space 80. The youngest player begins. A player advances as many spaces as a roll of the die. No moving backwards. If you roll a six, you may roll again. Only one pawn at a time on each number. Elimination is permitted.  If you land on an orange number, you must immediately follow the instructions printed on the side of the board.  Whoever gets both his pawns into the end space with exact roll of the die is the winner. Only one pawn at a time on each number. Elimination is permitted.

Examples of orange space instructions:


    31 says Gemeinsam duschen nach Fußallspiel spart Energie. 3 Felder vorrücken. On-line translation: Showering together after playing football saves energy. Advance three spaces.



    59: Panne legt großes Kraftwerk still. 2 Runden Aussetzen. Trans: Large power station shut-down. Lose two turns.

The gameboard is a thirty-six by thirty-six grid that represents a large body of water. The grid is divided into four quadrants. The players start with a small whale boat that is placed inside an individual’s factory ship. Each player places one’s own factory ship at an individual start space at the edge of one’s own quadrant. One of the whales is placed on one the four spaces in the center of the gameboard. Players, in turn, move their factory ships according to the number indicated on the spinner. If spinner points to a picture of a whale, then the whale moves according the number on its spinner. A player must separate the whale boat from the factory ship when the whale and the factory ship are in the same quadrant. Whale boats have their own spinner and they move slower that do the factory ships. When the whale boat and the whale are on the same space, the whale has been harpooned and the player scores a point for killing the whale. The whale boat must be moved back into the factory boat and another whale is brought into play. The last whale brought into play is white and it is worth two points. The player with the most points is the winner.

For two players. Description: Do you want to be a carnivore or a herbivore? Choose your side and head for the swamps! The players start off on opposite ends-with the task of crossing the swamp first. The herbivores need to look out so that they are not eaten by the carnivores, but the herbivores are more numerous.

Game includes 4 colored movers, a spinner, 3 step rulers (Baby Step, Grown Up Step, and Giant Step. The object of the game is to find and round up all 7 of the campers of your color group. You use the step rulers to try and land on the spaces occupied by your campers, by exact count. When you do you have capture that particular camper. Get all 7 and win the game.

Mikke Mus-spillet (The Mickey Mouse game) is a simple children's game where the goal is to be the first to skate through the park. There are various ways to the goal, and by taking shortcuts and avoiding Pluto running in the wrong directions, a player may find a shorter route through the park.

Contents:

Game board
Four pawns
Die

Mattekryss (Math scrabble) is a Scrabble-like game, only with numbers.

Each player always has seven tiles on his stands and try and make computations on the board. Each tile is placed next to two other tiles and must be the result of a computation (addition, subtraction, division or multiplication) of these two tiles. Some squares are pink, and restricts the type of operation to perform.

Contents:

Game board
106 tiles with numbers
Four stands

A simulation of International Show Jumping competitions with a choice of 16 identical horses, jumping over a choice of 16 jumps.

Players choose a course, choose a horse, or horses, and proceed around the course turning over Action Cards to decide the outcome of the round.  After 3 rounds, the winner is decided based on how few faults each horse has collected.

The idea of this game is to collect the nine pieces that make up a clown.  The game comes with 40 cards, each with a clown on one side of the card, and a portion of a larger clown puzzle piece on the backside.  Whoever collects the nine pieces of a larger puzzle first, wins the game.

In Wu-Pee Disney Card Game there are 4 different Disney characters to collect.

Box and cards are significantly smaller than usual card games.

(from publisher's website:)
How does a Minor Deity get more glory than the Minor Deity living next door?  By sending Minions into battle of course!

The funny folks at Cloud Kingdom games bring you a fantasy card game where each player becomes a Minor Deity.  The object of the game is to get the most Glory.  The trouble is that, ever since that “Atlantis Incident,” deities are no longer allowed to directly affect the material world.  The only way to get the glory is to send your adoring Minions out to do battle in your stead.

Each player controls eight amusing minions who are sent out to strive against the minions of your opponents.  The battleground is defined and, based on your minions’ attributes, you choose the best “ahem” man for the job.  You can then grant your minion a Boon to help him succeed.  At this point a combination of daring and luck may bring you the glory.  Dice are rolled.  Points are tallied.  Only one Minion will emerge to shower glory on their master.  Will it be you?

This game contains all the cards and components for a two player game and takes about 20 minutes to play, ages 10 and up.

How well do you know your World Geography?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the area in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Made exclusively for Starbucks Coffee stores.  Ballpark Blast uses dice and cards to play a three inning baseball based game.  Game contains baseball diamond, 4 game movers, 2 dice representing pitch and hit, pencil, and a score pad.  There are basic and advanced rules, both easy for a child to learn.

Game play consists of one player rolling the pitching die and another player the hitting die.  Based on the outcome the hitter may draw a card which will indicate the base score an out.
